newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Mint tenders for copper, zinc, nickel.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Mint tenders for copper, zinc, nickel.

text.p: The U.S. Mint said Thursday it was tendering for 1,629,000 kgs of copper cathodes, 241,000 kgs of nickel and 2,964,000 kgs of zinc for use in making coins.
Mint said offers to supply the copper were due at 1000 EST January 27. Nickel offers were due at 1000 EST on January 28 and the zinc at 1000 EST on January 29.
The Mint said it would purchase the copper in five lots for delivery during the weeks of February 17 and 24:
--816,000 kgs by rail to Olin Corp, Brass Group, East Alton, Illinois.
--736,000 kgs by rail PMX Industries Inc, Cedar Rapids Iowa.
--20,713 kgs truck to Alltrista Corp, c/o Conversion Resources, Delaware, Ohio.
--36,287 kgs by truck to Alltrista Corp, c/o International Metals & Chemicals Group, Shelby, North Carolina.
--20,000 kgs by truck to LaSalle Rolling Mills, c/o South Wire Co, Carrollton, Georgia.
The Mint said it would buy the nickel in two lots for delivery by truck during the weeks of February 17 and 24:
--124,000 kgs to Olin Corp, Brass Group, East Alton, Illinos.
--117,000 kgs to PMX Industries, Cedar Rapids, Iowa.
The Mint said it would purchase the zinc in two lots for delivery during the weeks of February 17 and 24:
--222,300 kgs by rail to Alltrista Corp, Alltrista Zinc Division, Greeneville, Tennessee.
--74,100 kgs by truck to LaSalle Rolling Mills, LaSalle, Illinois.
